results.title: The Boat = Das Boot (Director's cut) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bavaria Film, Gunther Rohrbach and Wolfgang Petersen
results.brief_description: An extraordinary depiction of life aboard a German U-boat and the courage of those who manned it, this suspenseful, exciting and realistic war drama set in 1941 chronicles the horrific experiences of an inexperienced crew and their courageous captain as they battle the Allies in World War II naval operations. The crew of the submarine are exposed to a myriad of dangers (not the least of which is madness) as they hunt and are in turn hunted throughout the Atlantic and Mediterranean oceans. Much of the film was shot in a real submarine to create a genuinely claustrophobic atmosphere. The film features little dialogue and goes to great lengths to display the boredom of the crew as they wait for instructions, and the terror that ensues when they do. Interestingly the crew’s loyalty lies with the navy and their captain rather than with the Nazis as the film adopts anti-Nazi overtones. Adapted from the German novel by Lothar G. Buchheim, which was based on his own experiences as a photographer aboard a U-boat in World War II. The film was originally released as a two and a half theatrical release as well as a six-hour German miniseries. This version is the extended director’s cut, released in 1997.

results.title: The Boarded window
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
This film is based on the famous horror story by Ambrose Bierce. It tells of a hunter whose young wife dies of fever. Her grief stricken husband prepares her body for burial, but during the night the forces of nature intervene to create a horrific and macabre ending. Restricted : postprimary schools only.

results.title: The Blues brothers. Blues brothers 2000 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Robert K Weiss, John Landis, Dan Aykroyd and Leslie Belzberg
results.brief_description: BLUES BROTHERS: At last, the Blues Brothers are back! John Belushi and Dan Aykroyd star in one of the most popular musical comedies of all time. Jake and Elwood Blues, two hoodlum brothers searching for redemption, set out to locate and re-enlist the members of their defunct rhythm and blues band in order to fulfil a “mission from God”. In their quest they are joined by an impressive array of guest stars including James Brown, Aretha Franklin, Carrie Fisher, John Candy, Ray Charles, Twiggy, Cab Calloway and Steven Spielberg. This madcap film has everything from exciting soul and blues music to one of the most amazing car chase scenes ever filmed, a film not to be missed. BLUES BROTHERS 2000: After serving 18 years for the chaos he was responsible for in the original film, Jake Blues (Dan Aykroyd) is released from jail and learns his brother Elwood has passed away. Even more shocking news is that his old mentor and the man he came to think of as his father Curtis has also passed away, leaving behind an illegitimate son. Determined to reform the band in their memory, Jake returns to the orphanage where he and Elwood were raised, only to be asked to care for 10 year old Buster, an orphan with an attitude similar to his own. Desperate for money to fund the band’s reformation, Jake visit’s Curtis’ son Cabel, a police sergeant. When Jake’s plea for money is unsuccessful, Buster steal’s Cabel’s wallet. The band is reformed with singer Mighty Mack (John Goodman) replacing Elwood in the lineup. With the police, the Russian Mafia and a militia group on their tails, the band travels across country to Louisiana, where they aim to win Queen Mousette’s Battle of the Bands. Also includes performances from Aretha Franklin, James Brown, Erykah Badu, B.B. King, Eric Clapton, Isaac Hayes, Bo Diddley, Dr. John, Travis Tritt, Steve Winwood and Clarence Clemmons.

results.title: The Blue yonder
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Annette Handley, Susan B Landau, Alan Shapiro and Mark Rosman
results.brief_description: 11-year-old Jonathan Knicks (Huckleberry Fox) is posed with an intriguing question about time travel by aviator/inventor Max Knickerbocker (Peter Coyote). He’s asking the wrong person, as Max is already an experienced time travellers thanks to the efforts of the time machine built by his neighbour, Henry Coogan (Art Carney). Unbenowst to Jonathan, Max is also his grandson and the time machine has allowed them to meet. Max learns that his discovery of the past and the fate of his grandfather forces him to decide whether to alter the course of the future. Also starring Dennis Lipscomb, Joe Flood and Mittie Smith.

results.title: The Blue ringed octopus
results.creator_credit: Wave Productions and Western Australia. Audio-Visual Education Branch
results.brief_description: Describes the venomous blue-ringed octopus, found in all coastal waters of Australia. If touched, this tiny creature’s rough skin causes abrasions through which a toxic and lethal poison enters the body, affects the nervous system, and paralyses the victim. There is no anti-venene, but the treatment is shown. No other credits available.

results.title: The Blue Planet (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of Sydney Television Service, Dept of Marine Services, Jim Dale and Roger Hudson
results.brief_description: Looks at the oceans of the World and the development of, and basics of oceanography. Considers the effect and benefit of scientific study of the oceans for sailors, yachtsmen, surfers, environmentalists, scientists, engineers and architects.
